Interface EnvironmentInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameEnvironment, Player

    public interface EnvironmentInterface
    This interface unifies the control classes ("environments") of the simulator and the player making it possible to use the same View object in both applications with only minor modifications.
    Author:
    Peter Eredics

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getSpeed()
      Returns the speed of the simulation
      boolean isDone()
      Indicates if the simulation is done.
      boolean isPaused()
      Indicates if the game or the playback is paused
      boolean isReady()
      Indicates if the simulation is started.
      void pause()
      Pause or step playback
      void play()
      Start forward playback
      void seekToPercent(float percent)
      Seek the playback to a given position in percents - used only in Player
      void setSpeed(int speed)
      Set the speed of the simulation

        Seek the playback to a given position in percents - used only in Player
        Parameters:
        percent - The relative position to seek to

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Indicates if the game or the playback is paused
        Returns:
        True if the simulaiton is paused

      • getSpeed

        int getSpeed()
        Returns the speed of the simulation
        Returns:
        Actual speed of the simulation

      • setSpeed

        void setSpeed(int speed)
        Set the speed of the simulation
        Parameters:
        speed - New speed of the simulation

      • isDone

        boolean isDone()
        Indicates if the simulation is done.
        Returns:
        True if the simulation is done.

      • isReady

        boolean isReady()
        Indicates if the simulation is started.
        Returns:
        True if the simulation is started.
